name: Saigon Shack
address: 114 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Ordered the brisket pho. Brisket was tough and chewy, I even went early when they opened - the brisket was most likely leftovers that was overcooked. Service isnâ€™t friendly. Wouldnâ€™t go back

Update: yep. Still the best Pho ğŸœ

Best pho and banh mi in NYC hands down. Iâ€™ve been coming here for over 5 years now and nothing compares. I love this place!â€¦

Been here since 2010, great since day1.
Highly recommend!! Very comforting pho & banh mi
food was good but omg pls change the playlist, why am i hearing rave/edm music at 11 IN THE MORNING ğŸ«© so overstimulating, couldnâ€™t even enjoy my pho in peace
Staff is so so, food is not so good as i expected, fried crab meat doesnâ€™t worth it. Also I donâ€™t understand why they donâ€™t still accept credit card .
BEST PHO EVER!!!!!

The complete package this place offers stands out. My taste buds were happy. This restaurant works well for group dining and offers a relaxed atmosphere. The workers were extremely pleasant, and were willing to respond to every question. It's a really nice place.

I always come here, but today they had an attitude. Me and my friends were a party of 3 and almost all the seats were taken. We were missing one person and because the large tables were taken, we thought we could just sit at the small onesâ€¦

The lemongrass chicken pho was transcendent! Seriously, I never order chicken pho and it was so satisfying - smoky salty sweet savory. The noodles were perfect and it was a generous portion size. I cannot wait to come back again.

The  servers were friendly when I arrived and left and Iâ€™m glad they mentioned they were cash only when I got there because it can be ambiguous at times.

The only thing that could have made the soup better was a larger side of bean sprouts, Thai basil or culantro. I can see why they wouldnâ€™t want to give these out of people donâ€™t use them but if personally could have used more.

I felt sad after my meal. The place has the feel. It has the clientele. It has the location. The bowl even looks right from the sidewalk. This pho should be straight banging but despite all that it does not live up to the billing. The pho chicken was rubbery. The bag of add ins was sparse. The broth was firmly classifiable as nothing special and where there should be an herbal almost medicinal quality to good pho broth it was just kinda sweet. Good pho should have the same restorative, ease creating, heart opening quality that every other cultures oldest soups share. Matzo ball. Korean chigae, pozole. The woman next to me at the counter said she had been going for 10 years and that they had indeed lost their touch. She said try China town. The bahn mi was alright but similarly nothing special.

summer roll is very fresh but a bit dry, beef pho is only mediocre. Kinda disappointed bc I had high hope
We tried to like the food since it's so convenient but couldn't. We had the banh mi and pho and neithem of them was good.

Great pho spot. I love their lemon grass chicken itâ€™s sweet, smoky, and incredibly juice. The portion is very big and the price is very affordable especially considering the location. Just to keep in mind that there might be a little wait line. We came here on a Monday 6pm and there were no available seats. Definitely will come again and try their rice dishes :)

The spicy beef short ribs pho was amazing. I go here just to get it. The crab cakes and spring rook and delicious too! The papaya mango salad is very refreshing especially after the pho.

Price is very reasonable, especially given where it is located. Portion was very generous as well - I couldnâ€™t even finish my vermicelli bowl in one setting. However, I do wish the dish would come with more fish sauce. The place was always packed, but we were lucky to score the bar seats. Service was speedy. Oh, and it is cash only!

Aesthetic ambience, good food, and nice service. It filled up quickly when the store opened. I love how the kitchen is open so there's no wall between customers and those working back-of-house. The classic beef pho is fabulous, especially on a chilly or rainy day
Best Pho in NYC!!!

Amazing food, the pho soup was delicious and the service is so great.
Highly recommended

Had the vermicelli bowl combo with pork chops and shrimp.  The pork chop was so tender, the flavor was immaculate.  We also had the shrimp pho, best broth and flavor I ever had.  This place is phenomenal!!!! 10 Stars for sure.  Our waiter was accommodating and well knowledgeable on the menu, knew just what we needed based on our preferences.

Was in a hurry and seeing a movie nearby, so I ordered pho for pickup and decided to eat it there. A man came out and yelled at me and said it's ok because theyre not busy but when I order in advance I'm not allowed to eat it at the restaurant. There was hardly anyone else in the restaurant, I was a paying customer, and making a point to yell at me for eating their food inside their restaurant was a very sad way to start my meal. The pho was fine, not mindblowing.
AMZ Pho in NYCğŸ˜‹We tried Saigon Shack pho, spicy ss special pho and fried spring rolls. All of these are really goodâ€¦

This is one of my favorite places in the city, food is amazing, also drinks, and service is great. Our server Julian was very friendly and helpful. This place is a taste of Vietnam in the heart of NYC. You have to eat there.  You canâ€™t go wrong with the lemongrass grilled chicken! Healthy, tasteful and a very generous portion. Awesome as always. ğŸ’›

Amazing Vietnamese spot! The bahn mis are so delicious, shrimp summer rolls fresh, coffee strong. Staff are friendly and welcoming. Price is reasonable. Service speed is excellent. Has outdoor seatings that are lovely.
The BEST raw beef pho I have ever had (and I am a really picky eater)! The soup was hot, the beef was thin and flavorful, the taste was heaven ~ I will definitly come back!
cash only. great food. busy on the weekend
Quick, casual banh mi and pho that never miss.
I loved the food! Julian is amazing ğŸ«¶ğŸ», very kind, and gave us incredible service.

I was not satisfied with the attitude of the woman serving us from the beginning when setting up the table for us and even when taking the order. She always showed her annoyance on her face. Because of that attitude, she was impatient when taking the order, leading to the wrong dish. Although I emphasized many times that I chose rice for that dish. But when it was brought out, it was still noodles. Normally, if the service brought out the wrong dish, I would still happily take it and not change it back. But because of the waitress's very bad service attitude, I had to force her to change it back to what I requested. To the waitress. If you feel upset and annoyed when you go to work, you should get a day off at home. Because going to work with an unpleasant face towards customers is really unfair. Because after eating, I still had to tip 20% for the bad service that I should not have received. In addition, with her bad face, customers will not want to come back and affect the owner's business.

I've been coming to Saigon Shack for 10+ years. I rarely get anything but the classic beef pho. It's my favorite in NYC. Big bowl, great service, reasonably priced. My order is always ready within a few minutes regardless if it's busy or not. One of my favorite spots in NYC. Friendly staff and Luisa is pretty awesome.
This is my special neighbourhood spot. My go-to order is the pork chop bÃ¡hn mÃ¬. Their staff is excellent too!

Unfriendly older waitress took over 15 minutes to take our order. Upon ordering she claims the vermicelli dish, which already comes with hot peppers couldnâ€™t be made extra spicy. Then, brings a coffee full of milk when a black coffee was ordered.  Also ordered a sandwich which arrived not only undercooked and soggy, but one half of the sandwich had its bread cut in the long directionâ€¦like hot dog. Also, overheard a customer at the table beside me upset about being given a dirty glass of water.
Good cheap food!
Fire
Just LOVE this place! Great food, great staff! I come with my husband all the time. The best pho Iâ€™ve ever had in my life! Super recommend!

The best of the best of the best ever!!
15 years and still going!!!
LOVE THIS PLACE!! Been coming here for years. The food and staff never disappoint. Veggie pho and Fish bahn mi are too good, my death row mealğŸ¤

I have been coming here for the last 3 years consistency, almost every weekend. Traveled through Vietnam twice and this place has by far the one of the best Pho broths on the planet. And donâ€™t get me started with the Banh Miâ€™sâ€¦ unrealâ€¦

Staff is always so exceptional and friendly. Really great experience every time. 100/10 experience EVERY SINGLE TIME!

RAW CHICKEN in the dish I ordered (lemongrass chicken pho). The server told us he would take it off the bill, and bring a substitute (which ended up being a side of bland vegetables). At the end of the meal, we were told he would have to charge us because I ate some of the pho. Wild.

Incredible broth, perfectly cooked noodles, and super fresh herbs. The flavors are rich and authentic, exactly what pho should be. Friendly staff and quick service make it even better. A go-to spot for comfort food done right!
Best authentic pho in the city
Saigon Shack is easy to love and their vegan Bahni Mi has my heart!! I have already lost count of how many times I have been! They are more than worth trying.

Bel posto consigliatomi da amici giÃ¡ venuti a NY. Se andate alla ricerca di qualcosa di diverso dai soliti panini qua i ramen e gli involtini di primavera si avvicinano molto a quelli â€œoriginaliâ€ (avvicinano, ho detto). Per non farvi fare un viaggio a vuoto, sul posto accettano solo pagamento â€œcash onlyâ€. Non so se sia una cosa temporanea o solo per turisti: Ã¨ ben visibile sul menu ma anche loro ti avvisano prima di farti ordinare. Non vi fate impressionare da un poâ€™ di fumo proveniente dalle griglie elettriche a vistaâ€¦ Ã¨ vietnamita anche quello!! ğŸ˜‚
Servers are super helpful. Food comes out very quick. Pho is delicious. Some items are cheaper when paying with cash, but everything is available to order online.

Amazing little place. We had the pho, crab cake, and spring rolls. The spicy Saigon pho with bok choi is GREAT. Note: it's cash only if paying at the register. You can use your card, but must pay online.
Great food and fast service!
Julian was very attentive and friendly. Good food and awesome service. 10/10

We waited for about 10 mins for a seat for a table for 7 and made sure to bring cash. Service was fast, and the food came out hot and fresh.

We ordered the brisket pho, pork chop with vermicelli, and the pork and shrimp spring rolls.

The pork and shrimp spring rolls were smaller than expected, but they were crispy and served piping hot. The flavors were good, though I wouldâ€™ve liked a slightly larger portion.

The brisket pho came with thinner noodles than Iâ€™m used to, but it worked well. There was a generous amount of brisket, and the portion was big enough to share with my daughter. It was flavorful without being overly salty. You can definitely taste the MSGâ€”it gives the broth that rich, savory depth that makes it so satisfying. I just wish it had been served hotter; I prefer my soup hot-hot.

The pork chop with vermicelli was deliciousâ€”according to my partner, who enjoyed every bite.

Iâ€™d recommend both dishes.

The seating is limited and the space is small, so I suggest coming early.

There is outdoor and indoor seating available.
